[4] moderately agree

while justice is certainly an essential component of a well-functioning society, it's not necessarily accurate to label it as the "most important" requirement. other factors, such as safety, education, and economic stability, also play crucial roles in shaping a society's overall well-being. nonetheless, it's hard to deny that justice is a fundamental building block of any just and equitable society, so i lean towards agreeing with the statement.
